newsitem.title: JAPAN: MOF receives 70.1 bln yen from private sector - BOJ.
newsitem.headline: MOF receives 70.1 bln yen from private sector - BOJ.

text.p: The Ministry of Finance (MOF) received 70.1 billion yen from the private sector in March through its special foreign exchange account, Bank of Japan (BOJ) data showed on Tuesday.
The ministry manages Japan's external reserves, which stood at $218.26 billion at the end of February.
Analysts said most of the money received came from private-sector purchases of 74 billion yen worth of financial bills (FBs) in March.

Any other money, in yen, received by the ministry in the month could have included payments made for dollar-selling intervention for yen, but bankers said there was no trace of such intervention in March.
The MOF does not comment on details of such payments.
The private-sector institutions concerned comprise commercial banks, foreign central banks, municipal governments, public funds and quasi-governmental organisations.
